witnesses.relationship_to_accused: widow of man who had financial dispute with accused's husband

testimony.quarrel_subject: debt - husband owed money to Nicolas Barret who was unwilling to wait for payment; sold field but repossessed within year and a day

testimony.quarrel_subject: Chrestienne remarked it was a pity to fatten his good milk cow

testimony.threat_quote: qu'il se taise, et moyennant que sadite femme ne se gaste de soy mesme, qu'elle retourneroit et qu'il n'en falloit point douter

witnesses.relationship_to_accused: brother-in-law of Demenge Jean Jean whose wife quarreled with accused

timeline.subject: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
timeline.details: Said she was over 50, denied all charges, explained reputation was due to confusion with another Chrestienne recently executed

timeline.subject: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; observed crying but shedding no tears; confessed to sergent Francois Cherier on return to prison

timeline.subject: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
timeline.details: Confessed to witchcraft for 6-7 years; claimed given powder which she tested on own cow; attended sabbat once; would not confess further despite threats

timeline.subject: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews on hands and feet, then racked; confessed to making hail at sabbat with Jehenne de Frumesnil; retracted confession when released, said sergent promised no torture and release if she confessed

timeline.subject: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
timeline.details: Repeated earlier confessions without torture; admitted killing Virion Bergier and others with powder; admitted numerous sabbat visits; briefly hoisted on strappado; tried to withdraw confessions

timeline.subject: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to execution, subject to repetition of confessions

accomplices_named.name: Jehenne de Frumesnil
accomplices_named.context: confessed to making hail at sabbat with her

prior_accusations.context: denounced a Chrestienne from Domjevin before execution; accused claims she was confused with another Chrestienne who was executed most recently (September 1603)
denounced Chrestienne 16 years before according to Mengin le Xeru

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
notable_quotes.french: qu'il se taise, et moyennant que sadite femme ne se gaste de soy mesme, qu'elle retourneroit et qu'il n'en falloit point douter
notable_quotes.english: let him be quiet, and provided that his wife does not destroy herself, she will return and there is no need to doubt it
notable_quotes.context: said to Jean Diez when his wife (later executed as witch) was imprisoned

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
notable_quotes.french: Tay toy, l'argent est aussy bon qu'il fut jamais, et pour de l'argent on en eschappera
notable_quotes.english: Be quiet, money is as good as it ever was, and for money one can escape
notable_quotes.context: response to her niece Jehenne wife of Jean Simonatte who feared being taken as witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Bastienne femme Colas Simonatte (describing son)
notable_quotes.french: tremissoit et herissoit et son petit corps tousjours sautellait sans aucun repos, estimant qu'il en mouroit
notable_quotes.english: trembled and shivered and his little body always jumped without any rest, thinking he would die from it
notable_quotes.context: describing son's illness after Chrestienne's visit during couches

notable_quotes.speaker: Bastienne femme Colas Simonatte (describing marital strife)
notable_quotes.french: son mary entra en une inimitié contre elle sy grande qu'ils ont esté plus de trois ans sans coucher ensembles
notable_quotes.english: her husband entered into such great enmity against her that they went more than three years without sleeping together
notable_quotes.context: marital discord attributed to accused's sorcery

notable_quotes.speaker: Chrestienne femme Nicolas Barret
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle scayt bien qu'ilz se haissoient voirement, mais que c'estoit desja auparavant leurs nopces
notable_quotes.english: that she knew well they truly hated each other, but it was already before their marriage
notable_quotes.context: her explanation for Colas Simonette's marital problems

notable_quotes.speaker: Bastienne femme Colas Simonatte (accused by Chrestienne)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle contoit bien souvent des mensonges
notable_quotes.english: that she very often told lies

notable_quotes.speaker: Bernard Parmentier's son (during demented illness)
notable_quotes.context: child called his godfather, the curé Messire Demenge, this during his fatal illness

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of Mengin le Xeru and his wife Allison
daughter of Mengin le Xeru and his wife Allison

relationships.person2: Jehenne wife of Demenge Jean Jean
relationships.evidence_text: 12 years ago his sister Jehenne, wife of Demenge Jean Jean

relationships.person1: Jehenne wife of Jean Simonatte le jeune

relationships.evidence_text: cooked them in house of her sister, the wife of Colas Diez
his late wife Chrestienne (in fact executed as a witch in September 1603)
Had often been to Nicolas Barret's house, because he was then maire

economic_context.details: Multiple property disputes involving fields sold with repurchase clauses. Virion Bergier owed money to Nicolas Barret and sold him field but repossessed it within year and a day. Jean Virion's father sold field to Nicolas Barret but withdrew from purchase. Jean Henry sold field cheaply to accused's son-in-law intending to repurchase within year and a day. Bernard Parmentier sold field cheaply to Nicolas Barret intending to repurchase. Chrestienne attempted to bribe Parmentiers with wheat to keep field.

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill and remained so until death 4 or 5 years later 'secq et decrepité' (dried out and decrepit)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: field sale - father sold field to accused's husband but husband withdrew from purchase; father took possession against Chrestienne's will

harms_catalog.harm_description: became sick with illness from which he died 3 or 4 years later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: debt dispute - owed money to Nicolas Barret who was unwilling to wait; sold field but repossessed within year and a day

harms_catalog.harm_description: trembled and shivered and body jumped without rest for 3 days and nights
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: third day of couches when Chrestienne visited and leaned on bed

harms_catalog.harm_description: marital discord - husband entered into such great enmity they went over 3 years without sleeping together
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused might have resented marriage as succession might have gone to brother married to her niece

harms_catalog.harm_description: cow's legs became debilitated; had to kill it and distribute meat among poor
harms_catalog.economic_value: worth 10 ecus, only received 9 francs after slaughter; unable to buy back field
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Chrestienne remarked more than once it was pity to fatten such good milk animal
wife didn't explain why; no quarrel mentioned

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, 'forcené et hors de son esprit' (demented and out of his mind)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: sister Jehenne quarreled with Chrestienne, telling her she was 'excessive en mauvais propos'

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill with headache, then demented calling mother witch and father devil; pushed away godfather curé calling him 'fat devil'; died after a month
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Chrestienne gave poor quality wheat as bribe to keep field; husband angry about poor quality
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: next Sunday after quarrel - child visited brother next door to Chrestienne's house and she gave him bread and cheese
harms_catalog.method_alleged: food - bread and cheese given by Chrestienne

harms_catalog.harm_description: died after accused tested powder on it

prior_legal_disputes.description: Gerardin's mother tried to cure him using herbs from Dom Jean de Xanrey; when Chrestienne touched herbs and realized she was being tested, she took offense and sued for reparation before the justice
Further quarrel between Gerardin's sister Jehenne and Chrestienne; they went to law but then came to an accord

legal_context.redress_outcome: obtained reparation through justice when she felt scandalized by being tested with herbs

hearsay_chains.content: uncle Gerardin became ill through bewitchment; mother's interactions with Dom Jean de Xanrey
several witches executed at Manonviller denounced Chrestienne 16 years before

same conversation about escaping for money
Gerardin's illness and herb touching incident

extraction_metadata.notes: Comprehensive trial record with detailed witness testimony. Case involves extensive property disputes centered on field sales with repurchase agreements. Notable pattern of economic conflict preceding accusations. Accused initially denied all, confessed under torture, retracted, renewed confession, then attempted to withdraw again. Confusion with another Chrestienne executed September 1603. Multiple victims cured by pilgrimage to Vergaville. Dom Jean de Xanrey provided counter-magic. Accused had previously sued for defamation when tested with magical herbs. Confession obtained through torture including thumbscrews, rack, and strappado. Executed 29 January 1604.
